data.title: Blog — Watertown Films
data.text:
Check Out Their Portfolio

An artist's body of work, or portfolio, frequently reveals their primary sources of aesthetic inspiration. Examining the videographer's portfolio can help narrow your options and ensure that their approach is consistent with your target.

The last thing you need is to work with a Portland wedding videographer with a unique aesthetic and then try to persuade them to embrace a more traditional one. You want your videographer to feel as free to use their imagination as possible for excellent results.

Read Reviews

Online or word-of-mouth recommendations and reviews dominate the wedding market. On social networking sites and chat forums, where you may learn about people's experiences working with various videographers, it's important to consider the recommendations provided by friends, family, and others.

By reading testimonials and recommendations, you can ensure that the videographer you choose has a reliable reputation and a successful track record.

Learn About Their Services

Professional wedding videographers frequently give their clients a selection of bundle options. These packages include descriptions of the service being supplied, the kind of delivery, and the delivery schedule.

Wedding videos can range from a minute to an hour, depending on the couple's choices. Delivery times could range from a few weeks to a few months, depending on how quickly the couple needs the movie. The wedding film is also accessible via a private link. In certain circumstances, the couple may wish to receive the wedding video on a flash drive.

Whatever you decide, be sure the wedding videographer you hire has the equipment needed to meet your target.

Consider Professionalism

Professionalism is a key consideration when choosing a videographer for an important event like a wedding. Along with being on time, this necessitates having a respectable demeanor, behavior, and level of readiness.

Your wedding videographer should be prepared to tackle the task, come on time, and be well-groomed to avoid offending you or your guests with their conduct, appearance, or carriage.

Assess Value

The finest wedding videographer values you, the soon-to-be bride or groom, more than their compensation. In the end, you want a pleasant memory of your special day.

To produce a product that is worth the money you paid and leaves you beaming from ear to ear, your videographer should be emotional about you, your guests, and your wedding that they go above and beyond to make it happen.

Conclusion

Choosing a wedding videographer can be a difficult decision. Considering the level of experience, budget, style, and quality of service are important factors to consider. Researching and asking the right questions can help you make the best decision.

It is also essential to connect with the videographer to feel comfortable with them and trust that they will capture your special day. Following these tips will help you choose the right wedding videographer and ensure that you get the best quality wedding video that you will cherish forever.

Watertown Films is a Portland Wedding Videographer specializing in capturing natural moments and creating wedding films that capture the essence of your day. Contact us today!

Capturing Images and Moments

A wedding video is a perfect way to preserve the memories of your special day. It allows you to relive all the movements and emotions of the event and to hear the laughter and speeches from you and the love of your life.

You can watch your first look, kiss as newlyweds, and dance together. If a drone was used, you could even view the venue from a birds-eye perspective. While photographs are an amazing way to capture a moment in time, wedding videography captures the whole day and all its emotions.

A Film to Treasure

Hiring a professional wedding videographer is essential as they will be able to create a beautiful and meaningful film of your entire wedding day, with all the emotions and memories captured forever. They will be able to edit the video footage and add music to create a movie that will make you laugh and cry as you relive your special day.

No Missed Memory

On your wedding day, you will not be able to experience every special moment. A videographer can help you be a part of all the events that you miss. They can record these moments on film, giving you the opportunity to look back and see all the special memories from your wedding day. Having a videographer present will provide you with a much more detailed view of your wedding and create a lasting memory that you can enjoy for years to come.

Sharing With Loved Ones

With the help of today's technology, a videographer can make it easy to share your wedding day with those who were not able to attend. Whether you are having a small, intimate ceremony or a destination wedding, you can quickly and easily upload your video to platforms like YouTube or Vimeo, providing an opportunity to share special moments with friends and family who could not be there.

Additionally, your videographer may be able to create clips of highlights from your day that you can share on social media. This way, you can make sure everyone is able to feel like they were a part of your special day, no matter where they are.

Final Thoughts

Wedding videographers offer couples a unique way to capture their special day. They can capture the whole atmosphere of the day, from the first kiss to the last dance. Wedding videography is an essential part of the wedding experience, as it allows couples to relive the moment years later.

Are you looking for a Boise wedding videographer? Trust Watertown Films, specializing in capturing natural moments and creating wedding films that capture the essence of your day. Inquire today!

Why Should You Elope in Idaho?

Idaho elopements are ideal for nature lovers. The state boasts more than 110 named mountain ranges with countless bodies of beautiful water running through them. If your ideal wedding involves an outdoor ceremony framed by snow-capped mountains and white-water rapids, then you’ve met your match. Idaho has more than enough natural beauty to go around.

How Do You Get Married in Idaho?

While you do not need to be an Idaho resident to obtain a marriage license in the state, the marriage licenses are only valid for ceremonies performed within state lines. You can obtain the license from the County Recorder with no appointment. Both you and your partner should go to the County Recorder’s Office with a valid form of identification and your social security numbers. It will cost around $30 to $50.

After you’ve been granted your marriage license, you can get married immediately. There is no waiting period, and you do not need a witness for your marriage. If you are not a U.S. resident, then you should bring identification from your home country. If either you or your partner does not have a social security number, then you will need to get a letter from the nearest Social Security Office.

What is the Best Time of Year to Elope in Idaho?

You know what they say…beauty is in the eye of the beholder. Idaho is a four-season state, which means snowy winters make their appearance just as intensely as the bright and sunny summers. Depending on what type of weather you want for an outdoor elopement, Idaho likely has it, and you can plan to get married during it.

Just beware that winter can come early and stick around for quite a while. Native Idahoans will tell you that October to April (or even May) can be considered “winter,” so unless you’re specifically seeking out a chillier elopement, it may be better to stick to a guaranteed summer month. And even if you’re okay with winter weather, trails can close because of excess snow. It’s always best to check that the area you want to elope in will be open and available during the time of year that you’re getting married.

In the end, the same goes for the summer. August in Boise, for example, is hot and dry. Temperatures regularly top 100 degrees. Sweating in a tux or wedding dress probably isn’t your ideal. Picking the right date can truly make a difference!

How Much Does an Idaho Elopement Cost?

The average cost of an elopement is around $21,000. This is less than half of what the average wedding costs. Here is what this figure includes:

$6,000 for a photographer

$6,000 for a videography

$3,000 for wedding attire

$150 for a wedding permit

$500 for an officiant

$500 for flowers

$400 for hair and make-up

$500 for food (if you have any)

$300 (optional)

$2,000 for event planner (optional)

$2,000 for travel and accommodation.

10 Best Places to Elope in Idaho

Now that you know what elopement may involve, you can decide whether it’s right for you. Elopements often focus on being in the moment and having an adventure. Fortunately, Idaho has no shortage of locations for that purpose. Between the mountains, lakes, and forests, there’s an ideal elopement location at every turn. Here are some of the best spots for you to keep in mind as you plan your big day.

Sun Valley

Sun Valley tops nearly all best places to elope in Idaho lists. It is a breathtaking spot with countless hiking trails that lead to mountain, lake, and forest views. Additionally, if you’re looking to elope in Idaho in the wintertime, then Sun Valley may be the perfect spot for you. The mountains in this area get tons of fresh powder which means you can incorporate downhill skiing, snowboarding, or snowshoeing into your day if you’re seeking extra adventure.

Here are some hikes you can research in the Sun Valley area…

Pioneer Cabin

Baker Lake

Alice Lake

Norton Pass

Proctor Mountain Trail

Stanley

Stanly is a small town in Idaho, but it holds the key to the Sawtooth Mountains, which is the perfect spot for an Idaho elopement. I’d recommend visiting in the summer for your elopement because businesses often close down in the wintertime. When it’s warm and sunny, you’ll find the hiking trails open and wildflowers blooming.

These are some of my top hiking trail recommendations…

Alice Lake

Bench Lakes

Sawtooth Lake

Goat Lake

Marshall Ridge

Titus Lake (Galena Summit)

Bruneau Sand Dunes

This is a unique spot to elope in Idaho and actually gives you a reprieve from the mountains and alpine lakes. Here, you’ll find a desert vibe with sand dunes. Bonus: Bruneau Sand Dunes are open year-round! Just make sure you factor in the inevitable heat in the summertime. A sunrise elopement during the summer months is one way to avoid the weather being too hot.

Coeur d’Alene

Coeur D’Alene is a beautiful lake and quaint town that local Idahoans love. You’ll find it full of delicious restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, and wineries. Since locals love it here too, you won’t find it quite so quiet, but it’s still one of the best places to elope in Idaho.

That said, you can still find the privacy you want if you head out into the nearby forest areas to hike. I have a list of my favorite hikes for Idaho elopements below.

Ermine Ridge Trail

Mineral Ridge National Recreation Trail

Tubbs Hill

Blue Creek Bay Trail

Fernan Lake Natural Area

Sandpoint Idaho

The Sandpoint area in Idaho is absolutely beautiful year-round. If you love the idea of Coeur d’Alene Lake, but you want something more remote, then Lake Pend in this region will be right up your alley. Select this spot for a backpacking, hiking, or camping elopement and soak in every second of it!

Here are some of the best hikes for an Idaho elopement at Sandpoint:

Portage Trail

St. Paul Lake

Scotchman Peak

Snow Lake

Gem lake

Priest Lake

Do yourself a favor and search “Elkins Resort on Priest Lake”? If this doesn’t look like a remote oasis fit for an Idaho elopement, I don’t know what does. These cozy cabins are one of the best places to start your life as partners, and you won’t be sorry you didn’t have that big, stressful wedding!

McCall

If you plan on bringing a small group of family or friends to your elopement, McCall is one of the best places for your Idaho elopement. The town is situated on the southern shore of Payette Lake, near the center of the Payette National Forest. The forest offers mountain views, gorgeous lakes, and alpine forests. You can fill your elopement weekend with hiking, backpacking, rafting, kayaking, snowshoeing, skiing, etc. The best of Idaho is at your fingertips!

Here are some of my top trail recommendations!

Clayburn Creek Trail

Louie Lake Trail

Council Mountain Hot Springs

Granite Mountain Trail 165

Goose Creek Falls

Craters of the Moon National Monument

The Craters of the Moon are an extinct lava field. This monument is an incredibly unique site that appears like a sea of black rocks. Up close, your wedding photos will make it look like you got married on a different planet. How cool is that? If you love a drier, desert vibe and want something truly distinctive, then this is the Idaho elopement location for you!

Grand Targhee

Grand Targhee Ski Resort is located on the Idaho side of the Teton’s border. If you want a less crowded and less expensive Jackson Hole, Wyoming elopement, then consider Driggs, Idaho! His option is perfect for adventurous couples on a budget.

Owyhee Canyonlands

The Owyhee Canyonlands are located about 100 miles from Boise in southwest Idaho. It features a remote landscape of gray-green sagebrush, junipers, and bunchgrass loom from horizon to horizon. If you’re looking to get away and be alone during your Idaho elopement, then this is one of the best spots in the state. It’s far less visited than areas like the Sawtooths or the Frank Church River of No Return Wilderness. Instead of meeting other hikers, you’ll see pronghorns, hawks, and bull snakes. Talk about a unique wedding experience!

Idaho Elopement Photographer

Choosing the right photographer is just as important as choosing the right location. That's why I’m here to introduce you to Autumn, an Idaho-based elopement photographer, and planner who is passionate about capturing the beauty and essence of outdoor weddings.

Autumn's love for nature and her husband's outdoor adventures inspired her to create an elopement brand that focuses on helping couples exchange vows in the great outdoors. She's a Leave No Trace aware photographer who advocates for sustainable and responsible use of natural spaces. Her mission is to help couples get married in a way that uplifts their unique relationship by creating an empowering space that is filled with adventure, meaningful connections, and expert guidance.

As an Idaho resident, Autumn is no stranger to the state's stunning landscapes. She calls the Salmon River home and serves McCall and beyond, capturing the beauty of the state's mountains, lakes, and forests in her photographs. With ten years of experience, she has the knowledge and expertise to help you plan and execute the perfect outdoor wedding.

So, if you're looking to elope in Idaho and want to capture the essence of your day in beautiful, natural surroundings, look no further than Autumn. She's passionate about helping couples create unforgettable memories and will work with you every step of the way to make sure your wedding is just as you've always dreamed it would be.

In conclusion, if you're looking to exchange vows in a serene and intimate setting, Idaho is the perfect place to do so. With a talented photographer and planner like Autumn on your side, you can be sure that your wedding will be a day to remember. So, start planning your outdoor wedding today and let Autumn capture the beauty of your special day!

https://www.autumnlynnephotography.com/

1) The Weather

The weather is the first thing you should consider when choosing an outdoor or indoor wedding venue. The weather can be unpredictable, and you need to make sure that your guests will be comfortable during the ceremony.

Indoor Venue: If you choose an indoor venue for your wedding, it will be easier to control the temperature.

Outdoor Venue: You need to be prepared for unpredictable weather. You will also need to find a venue that has a backup plan in case of inclement weather.

2) The Space

Before you choose a venue, make sure that its space is adequate for your guest list. You need to know how many people can fit inside the venue comfortably.

Indoor Venue: Some indoor facilities can only accommodate limited guests due to space limitations.

Outdoor Venue: On outdoor, on the other hand, you can have more guests because of the open space.

3) Decorations

When deciding on a venue for your wedding, think about the decorations you want to use. You will need to find a venue that can accommodate any type of decoration that you want.

Indoor Venue: If you have a specific theme for your wedding, then it would be best to choose an indoor venue, so there’s no chance of rain ruining your outdoor decorations.

Outdoor Venue: On the other hand, outdoor venues don’t allow much room for decor. But the advantage is that the venue itself can be used as decoration.

4) Photography and Video Opportunities

Photos and videos are some of the most important parts of a wedding. It’s your chance to capture all the special moments and memories in your life, so you want to ensure that the venues are conducive to good photos and videos.

Indoor Venue: If you choose an indoor venue, opt for one with plenty of different areas with unique characteristics so that your photos will look different from each other.

Outdoor Venue: If you choose an outdoor facility, look for one with lots of natural scenery to include in your pictures and video. If you want to get creative with your wedding documentation, choose a venue with plenty of different areas so your photographer can have options when it comes time to edit.

Conclusion

Your wedding is one of the most important events in your life. You must ensure that you choose the right place for your wedding. The venue should fit what you want and need. You don’t want to spend so much time and money on a venue only to find out later that it isn’t what you expected.

As you diligently prepare for the big day, let the videographers in Jackson Hole Wyoming help you capture all the special moments. Watertown Films will help you capture the most important moments of your wedding, so you can cherish them for years to come. Regardless if it is an indoor or outdoor venue, we will be there to capture it all.

Determine Your Budget

Wedding videography can be expensive, so you'll need to factor that into your decision. The videos for your special day are an essential part of your memories and are worth investing in.

However it's important to be aware of what you can genuinely afford so that you don't have any unexpected costs. Setting a budget can help you narrow down the list of potential videographers to hire, as it allows you to identify which ones are within your price range.

It can also provide a helpful point of reference when agreeing on your package with the videographer of your choice. Be bold and ask your potential videographers for quotes and compare prices to find the best deal.

Choose a Style That You Love

You'll want to decide what style of videography you want. Do you want a traditional, documentary-style video or a more creative, cinematic approach?

Consider what you want your video to look like. Since there are many different styles of wedding videography, make sure you choose one that you'll love watching back for years to come. Do you prefer classic styles, or something more modern and edgy? Any videographer worth their salt (like Watertown Films) can give you the look and feel you desire.

Do Your Research

Once you have the budget and the vision, you can look for wedding videographers that'd fit the criteria. Review portfolios from different videographers to understand their style and approach.

Alternatively, you can always ask for referrals, especially from your wedding planner. Referrals are an easy and reliable way to find reputable and talented wedding videographers.

Speak with the Videographer Before the Event

Choosing your wedding videographer is an important decision. So, getting along with the person you'll be working with is crucial. After all, you'll spend a lot of time with them on your big day. Make sure to ask questions that can gauge the videographer's personality and values. This can also assuage any apprehensions and clear up any misconceptions about the direction of your videography.

Get a Contract

Once you've done your research and met with different videographers, it's time to decide. Choose the professional you feel most comfortable with and who will capture your wedding day perfectly.

But most importantly, make sure to get a contract in writing. A written agreement will outline the services you'll be getting and will help protect you if something goes wrong.

It also sets out the expectations and rights of each party involved and ensures everyone is on the same page about the provided services.

Having a contract gives everyone peace of mind and helps avoid miscommunication. You'll find that having a legally binding document in case of disagreements protects both the client and the videographer.

Conclusion

With the right videographer, you can create lasting memories that you and your loved ones will be able to cherish for years to come. With a bit of planning and a lot of enthusiasm, you can find the perfect wedding videographer to capture your special day. So don't hesitate - to start your search today and make your dream wedding come to life!

Don’t hesitate to reach out to us at Watertown Films, your trusted wedding videographer in Seattle. Together we can create memory-filled wedding videos you’ll cherish for years.

1. Marries Sound and Picture

A professional videographer has the skills and equipment to capture not only the visuals but also the audio. When sound is included, it captures a complete picture of the event. Without sound, the video may lack the emotion and atmosphere of the day.

Audio and video tell a story differently—it encapsulates the moment, including the people cheering, the sound of the commotion, and the celebration happening as two people tie the knot. Overall, it makes the event live even after it finishes, allowing people to rewatch it.

2. Shows Every Event Detail

A professional videographer can capture all the event details, from the decorations to the guests' reactions. The level of detail is something that can’t be achieved in a photograph, and it allows you to relive the entire event. As a result, people get to see more of the happenings later.

Videographers can also capture moments that may have been overlooked in a photograph. They can capture the couple’s first kiss, the toast, the cake cutting, and all the other details that make a wedding truly special. Videographers can catch all the small details, telling the entire story.

3. Captures Unexpected Moments

A professional videographer can capture unexpected moments you may not have noticed during the event. They will be able to capture the candid moments that happen during the event that you may not have seen. It is these moments that make a wedding video truly special.

Candid moments can include icebreakers, the events before the bride walks down the aisle, or the groom waiting for her future wife while nervous at the altar. Videos stitched together, containing these unexpected moments, make an excellent souvenir for the couple.

4. Allows People to Rewatch

Having a professional wedding videographer allows you to rewatch your wedding day and relive the memories. Most couples can't remember every detail of their special day, so they can go back and watch the video to remember all the details.

Having a professional wedding videographer also allows people who couldn't attend the wedding to watch it and get an idea of what happened. It can be a great way to share memories with those who couldn't be there.

5. Freezes Time

Finally, having a professional wedding videographer allows you to freeze time and capture the moments you want to remember forever. A wedding video is a perfect way to remember your special day and will last much longer than a photograph.

Your wedding video will be something you can look back on for years to come and remember all the special moments of your wedding day. It's a great way to share your memories with family and friends, and it will be something you can look back on for years to come.

Conclusion

Having a professional wedding videographer is a great way to capture all the special moments of your wedding day. They can catch all the moments you want to remember forever and turn them into beautiful and memorable videos.

Not only will having a professional wedding videographer ensure that your wedding video is of the highest quality, but it will also allow you to freeze time and capture all the moments you want to remember forever.

Watertown Films is a wedding videography studio that captures moments in once-in-a-lifetime events. Our wedding videographer in Portland, Oregon, ensures clients will get a copy of their special day on film, allowing them to look back and see the celebration. Learn more about our process and reserve a date today.

Weddings are a momentous occasion that requires a lot of planning. Think about the joy of the day after it's all done–the anticipation of seeing your partner, the thrill of being announced as newlyweds, the touching speeches, and the hilarious dance moves of your closest friend. Those are the moments that you will want to keep forever.

Hiring a professional team to capture your wedding day is a great way to preserve memories that would otherwise fade over time. Having an experienced team manage the video production of your wedding day will ensure that you can relive these moments for years to come. Not only that, but the quality of the video footage and the care put into producing it will make the experience even more enjoyable and meaningful.

If you are still looking for reasons to hire a videographer for your big day, this article is perfect for you! Keep reading to learn more.

Capturing Moments You Mustn’t Miss

Videography style is a blend of documentary style and cinematic techniques to provide an unforgettable experience. Videographers strive to capture the most candid, meaningful moments without having to set up anything.

You'll see the joy on your dad's face when you walk down the aisle, watch the empty church fill up with anticipation, and be able to relive all the special moments shared between you and your bridal party. You definitely want to be able to savor all the fun of the dance floor even if you weren't there.

Combining the Beauty of Audio and Visuals

Having a videographer at your wedding allows you to capture the timeless audio and visual memories of your special day. You can look back and remember the meaningful words your mother said while you were getting ready and the funny stories told during the best man’s speech.

You can also remember the songs your guests danced to and the heartfelt emotions of your big day. All of these special moments are priceless and can only truly be captured on video.

Packing a Lot in a Short Time

A videographer is trained to capture the most important and memorable moments of your day. They will be discreet and won't disrupt the event, but they will still be able to capture the best shots. They will then edit the footage to create a highlight video that you can show to your family and friends and a longer version of the ceremony and reception.

Sharing Memories With Ease

In this digital age, sharing your video with the world is incredibly simple. You can upload your video to social media with just a few clicks and share it with your friends and family. You no longer have to wait for a VHS tape or DVD to arrive in the post–now, your beloved memories can be shared at the click of a button. So, no matter where your loved ones are in the world, they can experience your special day with you.

Unwinding on Your Special Day

You don't have to worry about getting pictures or videos at your event since a professional videographer is taking care of it. This leaves you and your guests free to enjoy the moment and not worry about getting the perfect shot. Everyone can relax and be fully present, knowing that the event is being properly documented.

Final Thoughts

On your special day, a team of skilled and experienced videographers will be there to document the joy and emotion of your union. Utilizing the most advanced cinematic and creative filmmaking techniques, they will capture your wedding in a unique and memorable way. Videographers can also guarantee a hassle-free experience, ensuring your wedding video is an unforgettable keepsake.

Do you need a wedding videographer? Choose Watertown Films, a boutique wedding videography studio. Reserve your date!

Tin Roof Barn Venue Information and Rental Details

Q: How many people can this location accommodate?

150 total, excluding lap children or babies.

Q: What is the rental fee and what is included in that price?

You'll have to submit an inquiry on our website to get the most up to date inventory and pricing.

Click Here for the contact page at Tin Roof Barn.

Q: How much is the deposit, when is it due, and is it refundable?

We require 50% up front and the other half is due midway between booking and your event. It is refundable if your date is booked by another couple. We always HIGHLY recommend investing in cancelation insurance which will cover all vendor deposits should they need to cancel.

Q: Can couples use the venue for… Bride & Groom Prep, Ceremony & Reception?

Yes

Q: Is the site handicap accessible?

Yes

Q: What's the cancellation policy?

If your date is rebooked, the deposit is refundable, otherwise it is not.

Q: What's your weather contingency plan for outdoor spaces?

We have a pavilion for the ceremony in the event of inclement weather.

Q: How long will I have use of the event space I reserve? Is there an overtime fee if I stay longer? Is there a minimum or maximum rental time?

Event hours are 12pm-10pm and 10pm-10:30pm for cleanup and guest departure. We do not allow overtime. For those couples that want to keep their party going, we have several suggestions for fantastic after party locations.

Q: Can I move things around and decorate to suit my purposes, or do I have to leave everything as is? Are there decoration guidelines/restrictions? Can I use real candles?

The venue is "as is." We have multiple guidelines as far as decorations and what can be used. Unfortunately, fire is a big issue in this area, so we do not allow flame of any sort with the exception of in our designated smoking area.

Q: Is there an outdoor space where my guests can mingle, and can it be heated and/or protected from the elements if necessary? Is there a separate indoor "socializing" space?

The barn courtyard is the best outdoor entertaining space, but we also have the pavilion which most couples use for cocktail hour entertainment. We do allow propane patio heaters in the barn as well as swamp coolers if it's going to be a hot one.

Q: Do you have an in-house caterer or a list of "preferred" caterers, or do I need to provide my own? If there is an in-house caterer, do I have the option of using an outside caterer instead?

We have a preferred list, but allow other caterers as well. The stipulation is that all catering must be full service - no DIY catering allowed.

Q: If couples do hire their own caterer, are kitchen facilities available for them?

We have a catering room for food prep and cleanup, but not a licensed kitchen. Most caterers will come prepared or grill outdoors if needed.

Q: Are tables, linens, chairs, plates, silverware, and glassware provided, or will I have to rent them myself or get them through my caterer?

We provide ceremony chairs, dining table and chairs, and indoor and outdoor furnishings. We also have a collection of mismatch tableware, but in some cases it is included, and in others it would have to be rented.

Q: Can I bring my own wine, beer or champagne, and is there a corkage fee if I do? Can I bring in other alcohol?

We allow wine, beer, and champagne at all times - and 2 signature drinks (containing hard alcohol) during cocktail hour.

Q: Are you licensed to provide alcohol service? If so, is alcohol priced per person? By consumption? Are there additional charges for bar staff? Is there a bar minimum that must be met before the conclusion of the event?

We do not have a liquor license so couples are responsible for the alcohol service. We do require a licensed bartender and a WA state Banquet Permit.

Q: Are there restrictions on what kind of music couples can play, or a time by which the music must end? Can the venue accommodate a DJ or live band?

We allow live bands during the ceremony and cocktail hour only. We don't have a restriction on what type of music can be played, but music ends at 10pm.

Q: Does the venue have an in-house audio visual system?

We have an in-house speaker system, but no visual.

Q: Is there parking on site?

We have parking for 75 vehicles and like to recommend group transportation. Our amazing coordinators at Union Event Co are happy to help set that up.

Q: How many restrooms are there?

We have a new restroom facility that is located steps from the barn.

Q: Do you offer on-site coordination? If so, what services are included and is there an additional charge for them?

We require "Wedding Day Management" through Union Event Co -this is a separate charge.

Q: Does the venue have liability insurance and/or do the couples need to get event insurance?

Tin Roof Barn does have liability coverage, but we require all events be covered with private event insurance as well. You can get insurance for your wedding at Wed Safe.

Q: Can couples hire their own vendors (caterer, coordinator, DJ, etc.), or must they select from a preferred vendor list?

Both... coordination through Union Event Co is required, the others are up to the couple to choose.

Q: Do you offer overnight accommodations? What are the nearest hotels to the venue?

We do not have overnight accommodations at Tin Roof Barn. Most people stay in Hood River which is only about 15 minutes from the venue. There are plenty of hotels, restaurants, wineries, breweries, and shops to keep all guests happy and entertained.

Q: Do you have signage or other aids to direct guests to my event?

We have a sign at the entrance, but the venue is easily found through Google maps.
